headline: GOP steps up recruitment efforts for black candidates and voters
author: WND News Services
sentences: When you see the rising prices in gas or rising prices in goods and everything else, the Black community is actually coming toward accepting the idea that maybe Republican policies are better than we see in the socialist values of the Biden administration, Wesley Hunt, a black candidate who was victorious in the GOP primary for Texas 38th Congressional District, told the Hill.

By Sebastian Hughes
Daily Caller News Foundation
Republicans have ramped up their efforts to recruit black candidates in the hopes of securing a larger piece of the African American vote in the 2022 midterm elections, the Hill reported Sunday.

The RNC announced in 2021 it would donate $2 million toward black community centers, which are designed to aid candidates with recruitment and voter outreach in their respective communities, The Hill reported.
In a CBS News poll released in February, black voters gave Biden a 43% approval rating for his handling of inflation, while 55% and 52% approved his handling of the economy and crime, respectively.
While black voters have traditionally supported Democrats at the polls, Republicans believe their recruitment, as well as messaging strategies, can win many over, the Hill reported.
As part of the launch, Hunt endorsed black congressional candidates John James in Michigans 10th Congressional District and Jeremy Hunt in Georgias 2nd Congressional District.
The Black community is seeing momentum, Paris Dennard, national spokesman and director of Black Media Affairs for the Republican National Committee (RNC), told the Hill.
At least 80 black candidates have filed as Republicans this cycle to run in House races, according to the National Republican Congressional Committee, the Hill reported.
Inflation rates surged to record highs in 2021, while murder increased for the first time in four years in 2020, according to FBI data released in September.
